© Estudiantina Cástor Vera Solano; Estudiantina Pichacani; Peña magisterial; Centro musical Enrique Miranda Campos; Centro musical Círculo Unión Puno; Centro musical Arpegios Puneños; Centro musical Quatro de octubre; Centro musical Mañazo; Centro musical Promoción 1973; Centro musical Alberto Rivarola; Estudiantina Unión magisterial de Huacullani; Trio universitario; Peter Cloudsley

Several groups perform three songs each at a folk music competition in Puno (Concurso departamental de estudiantinas y centros musicales). Group names and song titles (with genre or style between brackets) given below [The event's host's introduction to each group gives more information on the ensembles and the songs performed]. After the last performance, the winners of the competition are announced.
[0 min. 11 sec.] Unidentified group: unidentified songs.
[11 min. 30 sec.] Estudiantina Cástor Vera Solano: Choquelas (Captación); A tu lado (Marinera); Corazón mio (Huayno).
[21 min. 46 sec.] Estudiantina Pichacani: Recuerdos (Marinera); Kitulita (Huayno); Dos en uno (Kajelo).
[32 min. 20 sec.] Peña magisterial: 8 de diciembre (Captación / Sicuris); Canta la peña (Marinera); Kitulita (Huayno).
[47 min. 12 sec.] Centro musical Enrique Miranda Campos: Pankarita (Captación / Kajelo); Sufrir de amor (Marinera); Puneñita (Huayno).
[59 min. 12 sec.] Centro musical Círculo Unión Puno: Festividad de Santa Cruz (Captación); A ti Puno (Marinera); Carmencita (Huayno).
[1 hr. 11 min. 01 sec.] Centro musical Arpegios Puneños: Marcha del Sicuris (Captación); Cholita primorosa (Marinera); Mi barrio [...] (Huayno).
[1hr. 24 min. 22 sec.] Centro musical Quatro de octubre: Con orgullo (Marinera); 2) Mis cantares (Huayno); 3) Caperos [?] de Santa Cruz (Captación)
[1 hr. 36 min. 59 sec.] Centro musical Mañazo: Entrada de ceras (Captación); Mis amores (Marinera); Punañita (Huayno)
[1 hr. 46 min. 48 sec.] Centro musical Promoción 1973: Mi amor (Marinera); 2) Mi golondrina (Huayno); 3) Suni tokoris [...] (Captación).
[2 hr. 00 min. 16 sec.] Centro musical Alberto Rivarola: [? - Tune based on a costume dance from the Lampa province] (Captación); La engreída (Marinera); Puno querido (Huayno).
[2 hr. 10 min. 43 sec.] Estudiantina Unión magisterial de Huacullani: Pasco Pasquito (Captación); Linda punañita (Marinera); Corazón herido (Huayno).

[2 hr. 24 min. 04 sec.] Trio universitario: Hilda (vals); Destino (vals); Motivos de Los Morunos (bolero). This performance was recorded after the event's host announcement that the judges were about to decide on a winner, so this group may be performing as guests rather than participants in the competition.

[2 hr. 35 min. 07 sec.] Announcement of the winners of the competition: Centro musical Promoción 1973 (sixth place); Centro musical Lod Ferroviarios (fifth place); Centro musical Enrique Miranda Campos (fourth place); Centro musical Círculo Unión Puno (third); Peña magisterial (second); Estudiantina Pichacani (first). This is followed by the song Himno a Puno, likely played from the theatre's public address system.
The event's host mentions that the event is being broadcast by Puno radio station Radio Onda Azul.
Recording location in Puno noted inconsistently as: 'theatre in Puno', 'Cine Puno' and 'Stadium'.
On tape, this recording is preceded by a few seconds of unidentified content.

Music competition in Puno: first group (11:20)
Music competition in Puno: first group

This material is made available under a non-commercial streaming only licence. We have been unable to locate all owners of the copyright in this material. Please contact copyright@bl.uk with any information you have regarding this item.
Unidentified group performing two instrumental tunes and one song at a folk music competition in Puno (Concurso departamental de estudiantinas y centros musicales).
Instruments [identified by ear]: accordion, guitar, mandolin, quena. The quena is a notched flute with four-to-eight finger holes.
Recording location in Puno noted inconsistently as: 'theatre in Puno', 'Cine Puno' and 'Stadium'.
The event was also being broadcast by Puno radio station Radio Onda Azul.

Music competition in Puno: Estudiantina Cástor Vera Solano (10:16)
Music competition in Puno: Estudiantina Cástor Vera Solano

This material is made available under a non-commercial streaming only licence. We have been unable to locate all owners of the copyright in this material. Please contact copyright@bl.uk with any information you have regarding this item.
© Estudiantina Cástor Vera Solano; Peter Cloudsley
Estudiantina [student group] Cástor Vera Solano performing at a folk music competition in Puno (Concurso departamental de estudiantinas y centros musicales).
The group is announced as being from the 'Polo regional de educación artística' [regional hub for arts education]; group members individually introduced by the host at the start of the recording.
Pieces performed (style or genre between brackets): 1) Choquelas (Captación); 2) A tu lado (Marinera); 3) Corazón mio (Huayno). All the pieces are introduced as 'by anonymous'.
Instruments [identified by ear]: guitar, accordion, mandolin.
Recording location in Puno noted inconsistently as: 'theatre in Puno', 'Cine Puno' and 'Stadium'.
The event was also being broadcast by Puno radio station Radio Onda Azul.

Estudiantina [student group] Pichacani performing at a folk music competition in Puno (Concurso departamental de estudiantinas y centros musicales).
Pieces performed (style or genre between brackets): 1) Recuerdos (Marinera); 2) Kitulita (Huayno); 3) Dos en uno (Kajelo).
Instruments [identified by ear]: guitar, guitarrón, accordion, quenas. The guitarrón is a large-sized and lower-pitched guitar; the quena is a notched flute with four-to-eight finger holes.
Recording location in Puno noted inconsistently as: 'theatre in Puno', 'Cine Puno' and 'Stadium'.
The event's host mentions that the event is being broadcast by Puno radio station Radio Onda Azul.

Pieces performed (style or genre between brackets): 1) 8 de diciembre (Captación / Sicuris); 2) Canta la peña (Marinera); 3) Kitulita (Huayno).
Instruments [identified by ear]: guitar, guitarrón, mandolins. The guitarrón is a large-sized and lower-pitched guitar.
Recording location in Puno noted inconsistently as: 'theatre in Puno', 'Cine Puno' and 'Stadium'.
The event was also being broadcast by Puno radio station Radio Onda Azul.

Music competition in Puno: Centro musical Enrique Miranda Campos (12:01)
Music competition in Puno: Centro musical Enrique Miranda Campos

This material is made available under a non-commercial streaming only licence. We have been unable to locate all owners of the copyright in this material. Please contact copyright@bl.uk with any information you have regarding this item.
© Centro musical Enrique Miranda Campos; Peter Cloudsley

Ensemble Centro musical Enrique Miranda Campos, comprised of teachers and students from the homonymous school in Juliaca, performing at a folk music competition in Puno (Concurso departamental de estudiantinas y centros musicales).
Pieces performed (style or genre between brackets): 1) Pankarita (Captación / Kajelo); 2) Sufrir de amor (Marinera); 3) Puneñita (Huayno).

Instruments [identified by ear]: two guitars, charango, mandolins, guitarrón. The charango is a small guitar-like instrument from the Andean regions of Peru and Bolivia; the guitarrón is a large-sized and lower-pitched guitar.
Recording location in Puno noted inconsistently as: 'theatre in Puno', 'Cine Puno' and 'Stadium'.
The event was also being broadcast by Puno radio station Radio Onda Azul.

Music competition in Puno: Centro musical Arpegios Puneños (13:22)
Music competition in Puno: Centro musical Arpegios Puneños

This material is made available under a non-commercial streaming only licence. We have been unable to locate all owners of the copyright in this material. Please contact copyright@bl.uk with any information you have regarding this item.
© Centro musical Arpegios Puneños; Peter Cloudsley
Ensemble Centro musical Arpegios Puneños performing at a folk music competition in Puno (Concurso departamental de estudiantinas y centros musicales).
Pieces performed (style or genre between brackets): 1) Marcha del Sicuris (Captación); 2) Cholita primorosa (Marinera); 3) Mi barrio [...] [written by Carlos Frisancho Tevez] (Huayno).

Instruments [identified by ear]:  accordion, guitars, guitarrón, quenas, zampoña. The guitarrón is a large-sized and lower-pitched guitar; the quena is a notched flute with four-to-eight finger holes; the zampoña is an Andean panpipe.
Recording location in Puno noted inconsistently as: 'theatre in Puno', 'Cine Puno' and 'Stadium'.
The event was also being broadcast by Puno radio station Radio Onda Azul.

© Centro musical Quatro de octubre; Peter Cloudsley
Ensemble Centro musical Quatro de octubre, from Tiquillaca, performing at a folk music competition in Puno (Concurso departamental de estudiantinas y centros musicales).
Pieces performed (style or genre between brackets): 1) Con orgullo (Marinera); 2) Mis cantares (Huayno); 3) Caperos [?] de Santa Cruz (Captación).
Instruments [identified by ear]:  accordion, guitars, mandolins, guitarrón, zampoña. The guitarrón is a large-sized and lower-pitched guitar; the zampoña is an Andean panpipe.
Recording location in Puno noted inconsistently as: 'theatre in Puno', 'Cine Puno' and 'Stadium'; actual recording location transcribed by ear.
The event was also being broadcast by Puno radio station Radio Onda Azul.
Break during the third song due to cassette being changed.

Trio universitario performing at a folk music competition in Puno (Concurso departamental de estudiantinas y centros musicales).

This performance was recorded after the event's host announcement that the judges were about to decide on a winner, so this group may be performing as guests rather than participants in the competition.
Pieces performed (style or genre between brackets): 1) Hilda (vals); 2) Destino (vals); 3) Motivos de Los Morunos (bolero).
Recording location in Puno noted inconsistently as: 'theatre in Puno', 'Cine Puno' and 'Stadium'; actual recording location transcribed by ear.
The event was also being broadcast by Puno radio station Radio Onda Azul.
